captions.text: The lads have got a game tomorrow.

We like to go through a routine that we feel
covers everything. Getting the boys into line,

shot stopping, keeping the ball out of the
net.

Working on their technique, we talk about
the perfect save and their shape. This and

that, but first and foremost. Keep the ball
out of the net.

So we start off with a jog and a stretch,
covering the movement we'll be using in a game.

Then we go onto some footwork without a ball.
Because nobody makes saves unless you move your feet.
Your feet are what get you around the goal.
Then we go into some volleys.

This is the time where we practice catching
a ball.

If you can't catch it, can you parry it into
some good areas and finish it off. So if you
do spill it, are we onto the second one.

The next drill that we do is turning in off
of the post.

And there'll be a small goal, about three
yards. It's gonna be a pull back, on the shout

of turn we turn in flat to the line and we
balance our bodyweight and make the save.

If you're calm, you need to make a decision
as quick as possible. Sometimes it does take

a deflection and you just have to react and
get it away. But if you are going to parry

it, get it away as far as possible just to
make that save.
On your side square, get your hand over. Brilliant.

The next drill is very, very similar but you're
turning and it's a low collpasing save which

is again very common and we're working in
that same small goal.

It's amazing how many you save, even when
going into the big goals, because strikers

are just focussing on hitting that target.
You've got to be brave, stand in there and
react.

Get out of the small goal and that would have
stretched you much more.

The next drill is a little movement into line
for a volley from 6 or 7 yards then you move

quickly into a ball from the angle it's about
getting down the line to the ball getting

your angles right and just keeping that ball
out the net.
Good hand again, well done.

The next drill is a cone about 3 yards away
short, sharp steps. Got to be balanced, little

touch on the post, little step forward and
deal with a nice crisp half volley from ten
yards into that small goal.

It's just teaching your goalkeepers that even
from that distance even with balls coming
at pace, you can make saves. Brilliant!

The next thing we did we have the balls by
the post a 3 yard goal first and there's like

a little scrum half serve and it's a side
foot volley punched in.

Obviously you can't do the perfect save every
time. Sometimes you just have to react as

quick as possible and make that save. What
a save that is!
Brilliant.

So then we decide to go to the edge of the
box, about 18 - 20 yards. Set 3 cones up,

one in the middle and one either side, numbering
them 1 2 3. Give a little shout, it's about

keeping them aware, reacting to things. Remember
1 2 3. Short sharp, back in because that ball

could be on it's way at any time. Lots of
things that happen in sport are spontaneous.

The idea of this is just to give a bit more
variety. Great Feet. Two! Great save, up up
up! Okay great save. Ready for tomorrow?

The day before a game I feel that, that practice
we've done there will cover every save he

can make and make sure he's ready and bang
on it for the game.
